thread.title: Top Lehigh Valley events: Houston Ballet II, Oktoberfest and Lisa Fischer & Grand Baton
thread.title_full: Top Lehigh Valley events: Houston Ballet II, Oktoberfest and Lisa Fischer & Grand Baton - The Morning Call

author: Ryan Kneller
title: Top Lehigh Valley events: Houston Ballet II, Oktoberfest and Lisa Fischer & Grand Baton
text:
HOUSTON BALLET II
1 Watch exciting young dancers from around the globe perform mixed repertory during a Houston Ballet II show, 8 p.m. Saturday at Miller Symphony Hall in Allentown.
The group, the second company of Houston Ballet, is comprised of students who are on the precipice of joining major companies. Repertory includes classical works such as George Balanchine's "Allegro Brillante," Stanton Welch's "The Long and Winding Road" and August Bournonville's "Flower Festival in Genzano," and contemporary works such as Garrett Smith's "Mortal Form" and "Murcof," and Melody Mennite's "Next of Kin."
Tickets are $28-$38. Miller Symphony Hall is at 23 N. Sixth St. Info: millersymphonyhall.org.
OKTOBERFEST
2 Celebrate German food, music and culture during the final weekend of ArtsQuest's fifth annual Oktoberfest at SteelStacks in Bethlehem.
Highlights of the free event include a Festhalle tent featuring food, beer and music; vendors selling German-themed merchandise; dachshund and stein races; barrel-rolling and other games; kids activities; and a Brewers Village, with more than 25 beers by Pennsylvania craft breweries ($30 ticket).
Hours are 5-10 p.m. Friday, noon-10 p.m. Saturday and noon-8 p.m. Sunday. Info: artsquest.org.
LISA FISCHER & GRAND BATON
3 Grammy winner Lisa Fischer, who has toured and recorded with big name artists such Tina Turner, Chaka Khan, Beyonce and Alicia Keys, performs with her band Grand Baton at 8 p.m. Saturday at Zoellner Arts Center. Fischer is one of the singers featured in Morgan Neville's 2013 documentary "Twenty Feet From Stardom." She and Darlene Love, Patti Austin and Judith Hill were known as "the greatest artists you've never heard of." Following the movie's success, she put together Grand Baton.
Tickets are $30-$45. Info: 610-758-2787 or zoellnerartscenter.org.
